body_html:
Just wanted to post an update on #9091 (cpu growth unbounded with feed dicts).

  • the error is not due to graph not being fixed
  • it is not caused by usingtf.zeros vs. tf.fill
  • I'm using cudnnLstm, not dynamic_rnn, so while_loops are also not the cause

After updating to Tensorflow 1.6, the CPU growth dropped from the original 640mb/hr down to 25mb/hr (at most, not sure what the curve looks like). [e.g process starts out with 13.2gb of RAM, and 8 hours later is at 13.4gb of RAM]

I now consider this issue fixed to the best of my knowledge!

body:
Just wanted to post an update on #9091 (cpu growth unbounded with feed dicts).
- the error is not due to graph not being fixed
- it is not caused by using`tf.zeros` vs. `tf.fill`
- I'm using `cudnnLstm`, not `dynamic_rnn`, so while_loops are also not the cause

After updating to Tensorflow 1.6, the CPU growth dropped from the original 640mb/hr down to 25mb/hr (at most, not sure what the curve looks like). [e.g process starts out with 13.2gb of RAM, and 8 hours later is at 13.4gb of RAM]

I now consider this issue fixed to the best of my knowledge!
